revised_title: Microscopic Observations of Blood, Milk, Bones, Brain, and Other Tissues
tldr: The author, Mr. Leeuwenhoeck, investigates the microscopic structure of blood, milk, bones, brain, and other tissues using a microscope and hollow glass pipes. He observes that blood consists of small red globules, bones are made up of transparent globules, and the brain and liver contain fine globules. The author also discusses the process of observing these structures and shares his findings with the Royal Society.
